column3: United States. The population was 17

column7: Orinda was ranked the second most friendly town in America by Forbes. The city is located just east of the city of Berkeley and is home to many affluent suburban professionals who commute to larger cities in the Bay Area such as Oakland
column9: and Walnut Creek. Its location provides for a more rustic landscape
column10: and Orinda's many parks and trails make it a destination for many Bay Area hikers and naturalists.

column1: Orinda is located within four Mexican land grants: Rancho Laguna de los Palos Colorados
column3: Rancho El Sobrante and Rancho Boca de la Cañada del Pinole. The area was originally rural
column4: mainly known for ranching and summer cabins. In the late-19th century
column5: the land was named by Alice Marsh Cameron
column6: probably in honor of the poet Katherine Philips
column7: who was also known as the "Matchless Orinda".In the 1880s
column8: the United States Surveyor General for California
column10: built an estate which he named Orinda Park. The Orinda Park post office opened in 1888. The post office's name was changed to Orinda in 1895. Orinda was also the site of Bryant Station
column11: a stop on the failed California and Nevada Railroad around the turn of the 20th century. In later times
column12: the area around Bryant Station was known as Orinda Crossroads.Orinda's popularity as a year-round residence grew after the 1937 completion of the Caldecott Tunnel
column13: which provided easier access to the west. Bisected by California State Route 24 and framed by its rolling oak-covered hills
column14: the city of Orinda was incorporated on July 1
column15: 1985. Its first mayor was Richard G. Heggie. The city has a station on the Antioch–SFO/Millbrae line of the Bay Area Rapid Transit.

column1: According to the United States Census Bureau
column2: the city has a total area of 12.7 sq mi (33 km2)
column3: of which 12.7 sq mi (33 km2) of it is land and 0.015 sq mi (0.039 km2) of it (0.12%) is water.

column1: The area is characterized by a warm-summer Mediterranean climate (Köppen climate classification Csb) with cool
column3: dry summers. Because Orinda is located in a hilly area
column4: microclimates often dominate temperature differences in short distances. The Oakland Hills often block the cool foggy conditions that can be seen in Oakland and the innerbay. In the summer
column5: fog can spill over the Oakland hills
column6: cooling off the area. Heatwaves from the inland areas can be felt much more in Orinda than in Oakland and the innerbay during the summer. In the winter
column7: Orinda often sees more precipitation than surrounding areas because of its higher elevation. Snowfall is rare but not unheard of. A dusting of snow may occur in any given year because of the elevation. During stable conditions in the winter
column8: mornings can be cold and frosty in downtown and lower-lying areas
column9: while the higher hills surrounding the area may be several degrees warmer.

column1: Orinda has four public elementary schools: Sleepy Hollow Elementary
column3: Glorietta Elementary and Del Rey Elementary. Orinda Intermediate School is the only middle school. Together
column4: these five schools comprise the Orinda Union School District. The town's only high school
column6: is a part of the Acalanes Union High School District.

column1: Both districts are noted for their academic excellence. Each district is the highest ranked in California in its category according to the state Academic Performance Index (API).
column2: Miramonte High School also features strong athletic teams and has produced NFL players as Ken Dorsey
column3: Drew Bennett and Bryan Barker
column4: as well as several Olympians like women's waterpolo player Heather Petri. Miramonte consistently has a high graduation rate of 99%–100%. The community support for education allows the high school to attract and retain very qualified teachers. The annual average teacher salary for the district is $74
column5: 135. The average principal salary for the district is $130

column1: Orinda is home to three private educational establishments; Orinda Academy
column3: and Fountainhead Montessori School. Out of these three private schools two of them (OA & Holden) are private high schools while Fountainhead Montessori School services Kindergarten through fifth grade.

column3: and the arts ==

column2: Orinda began hosting the Orinda Film Festival
column3: an annual regional film festival taking place at the historic Orinda Theatre managed by Randy Holleschau. In 2005
column4: actor William Hurt attended the festival to promote the film The Blue Butterfly in which he played a leading role. The festival was last held in 2005. The bright lights of the theater are visible for miles around during the night.

column2: the California Independent Film Festival announced they will be making the Orinda Theatre their new home. CIFF held its first event in Orinda on September 18
column4: in which a screening of The Birds was attended by actress Tippi Hedren. The 12th Annual California Independent Film Festival was the first time the festival was held in Orinda
